FuncDef:
The priority threshold command sets the buffer threshold for antilocking PFC to take effect.
The undo priority threshold command restores the default buffer threshold for antilocking PFC to take effect. The priority threshold command sets the buffer threshold for antilocking PFC to take effect. The undo priority threshold command restores the default buffer threshold for antilocking PFC to take effect. By default, the buffer threshold for antilocking PFC to take effect is 0. This command is supported only on the CE6885-SAN.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the priority.
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 7.

Specifies the buffer threshold for antilocking PFC to take effect.
The value is an integer that ranges from 0 to 512. The unit is KB and the default value is 0.

ExtraInfo: You can run this command to configure the buffer threshold for antilocking PFC to take effect based on priority queues.
